Posts.Content: thanks for the quick reply i do want to ask another question did you have the muga test before your first cycle of A/C  because they want me to go in for the test on the 21st dec just thought it would have been done before it starts to get a base line . glad to hear you have had no effects so far goog luck for the 21st  x claire
Posts.Title: what to expect with my 1st chemo

Posts.Content: hi everyone i am having my 1st shot of A/C chemo this thursday and i am scared stiff. i would like some info on what to expect after the first dose, and if anyone of you lovely ladies could give me some tips on how to get through it : ) i am 37 and have two children oldest being 13 and youngest 4 years and i am worried about coping but still having to run the home ect any help would be great thanks x
Posts.Title: what to expect with my 1st chemo

Posts.Content: hi lorenz  thankyou for your reply i am always saying to myself i shouldn't be afraid and i come across to people friends and family that i am strong but inside im not : ( im just taking each day as it comes, but i will do as you say during the hard times think of the good things and smile : ) thanks for the more fluids tip i will do it take care x claire
Posts.Title: what to expect with my 1st chemo

Posts.Content: hi wendy  the test is called a muga rest heart scan  this involves 2 injections 20 minutes apart the 2nd injection has a small amount of radioactive material this test shows how well your heart is working, hope this helps x claire
Posts.Title: what to expect with my 1st chemo

Posts.Content: hi wendy i am also on the AC chemo like what chat 2sue said above i am finding it not to bad it hits me within 24 hours of having a dose feeling a bit sick and very tired and whoozy but about the 4th day i start to pick up again. i am having 4 cycles 3 weeks apart, my second is on the 5th jan i did have to ask for the intravenous sickness though but they did give me 2 days steroids and 2 days sickness tablets .xx good luck xx claire
Posts.Title: AC Chemo followed by Taxotere

Posts.Content: hi wendy i was given DEXAMETHASONE 2mg  2 tablets twice a day and yes i was given the sicknes tablets at the same time but i did ask for the intravenous sickness as well just to make sure : ) my second dose is on the 5th jan so no hair loss as of  yet just alittle when i wash it, but one thing is that i do get heartburn but in the first few days i did have terrible toilet trouble but it is a small price to pay, but i made sure i was stocked up on things like heartburn tablets and things.
Posts.Title: AC Chemo followed by Taxotere

Posts.Content: well thursday was my 1st treatment day but the poor nurses just could not get a vein ( not for the want of trying mind you ) so had a mid line put in yesterday best thing they could have done because my veins are so small and very deep they can only really find them with a ultra sound . this is alot less stressful on me so i no know i am not going to be a pin cushion for a day and for nurses involved so 1st chemo done and 3 to go xxxxx HUGGS to everyone
Posts.Title: mid line put in and 1st chemo done : )

Posts.Content: Thankyou everyone :) just got back from the breast unit and got no answers at all about the bugger being back so quick all i got was we don't know why it is very rare that this happens.  they are sending me for a ct scan  then they will plan from when the results are back from it, what they did say was if it has spread it wouldn't be cured but will be controlled but i will need chemo again : ( either way xxxxx
Posts.Title: don't know what the hell to think anymore : (

Posts.Content: thankyou to everyone for you kind words. i had a lumpectomy first time round and was grade 3 so needed chemo the primary lump was 2.5 cm. i am on tamoxifen and a trail drug as well  : (After surgery there was a hardness around the area as to be expected but has slowly been getting bigger but i thought scar tissue or fatty tissue until last week when i felt it and it had become too big for me to put down to scar tissue or anything else. my heads in total meltdown i am so many mixed emotions at the moment, i just cannot get my head around the fact it has come back so quickly so i am thinking it never went away in the first place. my tablets just starting to kick in what the dr gave me to help with sleep so i will say good night to everyone and hope things can only get better xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: don't know what the hell to think anymore : (

Posts.Content: I have been this afternoon for my pathology report on my recurrence in my left breast. i had the full works first time around and was told by the bcn that she thought i would need chemo again as it was a grade 3 again but was told today that because the chemo rads and tamoxifen has not worked first time around last chemo in march and because i am pre menopause at the age of 38 they want to give me injections to kick start my menopause because they said they have more treatment options when you have already been through the menopause i just wondered if anyone else has experenced this at all. xxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Has anyone been brought into early menopause by injection.

Posts.Content: need to talk i finished my treatment on the 20th april this year i had 4 rounds of ac chemo and 4 weeks of rads only to be told today my cancer has returned. I am so numb i don't feel anything i get my plan of action tomorrow morning i want to ask so many questions but i can't think straight : ( how can it come back to quickly can anyone please give me a hint on what questions to ask.  xxxx
Posts.Title: don't know what the hell to think anymore : (

Posts.Content: I haven't posted alot to this group but i have read and reread most of the post's on here : ) which have been a great support to me these past months. Had chemo and my last radio was today so i want to say a BIG BIG thankyou to each and everyone of you on here : ) i never thought i would ever reach the end but you do, it is a long journey that we undertake but you DO get there. take each and everyday as it comes when your knocked down and feeling like you have nothing left to give in your body have a cry have a shout if it helps ( it did me : ) get back up and kick  the BIG C s   a**e.. Sending huggs and support to everyone who it at the beginning of there journey and well done to everyone who has finished there treatment. xxx
Posts.Title: Finished treatment today

Posts.Content: Hi lyn, i am booked in  on monday for my mx i have also been looking for something to hold the drains, my bcn said the hospital should provide the holders for the drains. I have been packing and repacking my little hospital bag i am so nervous i posted on here a few weeks ago and took all the advice on board about what to wear, but like what the other ladies have said button up front pjs  and i wish your daughter and yourself all the best for tuesday xxxx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Didn't think i would be back so soon : (  just been told today i have a 2nd recurrence on my left side. My first diagnosis was in oct 2011 had a lumpectomy chemo and rads i thought that was the end of it, all active treatment finished in april 2012 but in august that year i felt a lump in the breast i got fobbed off so many times by the doctors telling me it was impossible for it to return so quickly after treatment so i thought they no best and left it for a while, but in my mind i knew something was not right so i made a stand and had a biopsy and low and behold it was back, so had a mx in sept 2012 but no other treatment as i was told it didn't work the fist time so wouldn't this time dr told me to look him in the eye and said the mx would have got it. ok i thought brilliant but the past few months i have been in pain going back and forth to the breast unit again surgeons telling me i don't warrant any tests or scans because the ones i had showed up nothing again i thought ok i must be fine and i am thinking to much into things, but last week i went to my local gp to talk about my pain meds and asked him to look at a small frozen pea sized lump which i thought was a mozzie bite on my chest wall he referred me straight away and today i was told the lump is cancer so in all i have been diagnosed 3 times in 2 years. i am angry , numb, and have been having panic attacks i am afraid for my kids who are 6 and 14 having to see me go through this again xxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: 2nd recurrence in 2 years.

Posts.Content: Thank you to everyone for you kind and much needed support  : ) I do feel that the powers that be treat you differently the 2nd time round,  Only you know your own body what feels right and what doesn't so to everyone who feels something is not quite right stand your ground until someone take's notice and make sure all the proper checks are done . I think with mine it has not been the text book cancer that they thought it should be and have been a bit lapsy daisy about it and took everything for granted. but you know the saying  third time lucky : )  xxx claire
Posts.Title: 2nd recurrence in 2 years.

Posts.Content: Thank you for both your messages, i suppose i am lucky in one way that yes i have found all the cancers by myself, but it shows you that if you feel something is not right with yourself kick up a fuss until you are checked properly.  I am in derbyshire so will have a look about for a support group this time. i feel diffrent this time round i don't know why it is strange.  I go for a ct scan next saturday and then results on the monday and hopefully get  a plan of action.   thank you both for the huggs i do need them xxx claire
Posts.Title: 2nd recurrence in 2 years.
